net.tinyos.prowler.floodrouting

Class RoutingApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tinyos.prowler.floodrouting.RoutingApplication

  • public class RoutingApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a base class for all the routing applications, all such application should be derived from this.
    Author:
    Gabor Pap (gabor.pap@vanderbilt.edu)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte DIRTY_AGING
      Only aging is required, no sending
      static byte DIRTY_CLEAN
      No action is needed for this routing application
      static byte DIRTY_SENDING
      Some packets are ready to be sent

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RoutingApplication(int maxDataPerMsg, int maxDataPacketNum, RoutingPolicy policy, FloodRouting framework, java.lang.Class dataPacketClass)
      A parameterized constructor.

    • Field Detail

      • DIRTY_AGING

        public static byte DIRTY_AGING
        Only aging is required, no sending

    • Constructor Detail

      • RoutingApplication

        public RoutingApplication(int maxDataPerMsg,
                  int maxDataPacketNum,
                  RoutingPolicy policy,
                  FloodRouting framework,
                  java.lang.Class dataPacketClass)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        A parameterized constructor.
        WARNING! After constructing all the neccessary routing applications don't forget to call the FloodRouting.initialize() method, otherwise the whole simulation will just not work as expected.
        Parameters:
        maxDataPerMsg - the maximum number of data packets per message
        maxDataPacketNum - the maximum number of data packets per application
        policy - the routing policy
        framework - the floodrouting application to which this routing application is attached to
        dataPacketClass - the implementation class of the DataPacket abstract class
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • setBufferSize

        public void setBufferSize(int newBufferSize)
        This method is called to modify the size of the buffer in a mote.
        Parameters:
        newBufferSize - the new size of the internal buffer of a mote.

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Called inbetween two simulation runs. Clears the memory allocated to the application and resets the variables to their default value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sendDataPacket

        public final boolean sendDataPacket(DataPacket data)
        This simply adds the DataPacket to the list of packets (if it is not already there) and tries to send it.
        Parameters:
        data - the DataPacket to be sent
        Returns:
        true if the data was succesfully scheduled to be sent, false if the same data is already scheduled or if there is not enough buffer space to store the message.

      • getRoutingFramework

        public FloodRouting getRoutingFramework()
        this returns the FloodRouting application in which this routing application works.
